servinfo.title: Compression Check
servinfo.ptxt: Check compression pressure on all 4 cylinders as follows:

s1.ptxt: Warm up engine to normal operating temperature.

attention3.ptxt: After warming up engine, place transaxle gear shift lever in “Neutral”, and set parking brake and block drive wheels.

s1.ptxt: Remove ignition coil assemblies (2) with high-tension cord (3).
Disconnect fuel injector wires (4) at the coupler.
Install special tools (Compression gauge) into spark plug hole.
Disengage clutch (to lighten starting load on engine) for M/T vehicle, and depress accelerator pedal (1) all the way to make throttle fully open.
Crank engine with fully charged battery, and read the highest pressure on compression gauge.

item.ptxt: For measuring compression pressure, crank engine at least 250 r/min. by using fully charged battery.

If measured compression pressure is lower than limit value, check installation condition of special tool. If it is properly installed, possibility is compression pressure leakage from where piston ring and valve contact.

spec.title: Compression pressure
spec.ptxt: Max. difference between any two cylinders: 100 kPa (1.0 kg/cm², 14.2 psi)

s1.ptxt: Carry out Steps 7) through 9) on each cylinder to obtain 4 readings.
After checking, install spark plugs and ignition coil assemblies (2) with high-tension cord (3).
Connect fuel injector wires (4) at the coupler.
